text: Castanopsis oligoneura is a tree in the family Fagaceae. The specific epithet ' is from the Greek meaning "few nerves", referring to the leaf venation. ==Description== Castanopsis oligoneura grows as a tree up to tall with a trunk diameter of up to . The brownish bark is smooth to lenticellate. The coriaceous leaves measure up to long. Its roundish nuts measure up to long. ==Distribution and habitat== Castanopsis oligoneura is endemic to Borneo. Its habitat is lowland dipterocarp forests up to altitude. ==References== oligoneura Category:Endemic flora of Borneo Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Plants described in 1968
title: Castanopsis oligoneura
